802.1X, for those who may not be familiar,
is an authentication protocol.

It's a good thing.

Not all clients are capable of handling it.

in, but older additions do not. Over time, I suspect that we'll see that go away,
and I think that likely we'll see a lot more of 802.1X.

or you can tunnel through the protocols that are unfiltered.
It's a difference between a firewall that denies all by default and denies none by default.
